Since January 1996, she served as President of Chevron International Oil Company, a subsidiary of Chevron Corp. and Vice President of logistics and trading for Chevron Products Co. and was responsible for supply and distribution and worldwide trading. She is an internationally recognized business leader, working frequently with government officials, heads of state, business partners and community stakeholders across the globe. She has been the Executive Chairperson at Archer Daniels Midland Company since February 2007 and its Executive Director since May 1, 2006. She has been Director at Procter & Gamble Co., since January 8, 2008. She serves on the Board of Directors of American Petroleum Institute, the Board of Trustees of the University of San Diego in California, as well as the Board of Visitors of Pennsylvania State University. In 2000, Fortune magazine named Ms. Woertz one of the top ten most powerful women in business. In 2005, she was named a Distinguished Alumna by Pennsylvania State University. Ms. Woertz graduated in 1974 with a BS in Accounting from Pennsylvania State University. In October 1994, she graduated from Columbia University's International Executive Development Program.

column10: Mr. Timothy M. Ring, also known as Tim, has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at CR Bard Inc. since August 8, 2003. In 1999, Mr. Ring was named Group President at Bard Electrophysiology and Peripheral Vascular Products and in 2002 was given additional responsibility for Bard Access Systems, Bard Europe, and Corporate Healthcare Services. Mr. Ring served as a Group President at CR Bard Inc. from April 1997 to August 2003 with most recent oversight for Bard's ... Corporate Healthcare, Peripheral Vascular, Access Systems, and Electrophysiology Divisions as well as for all Bard's businesses in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa until August 2003. He joined CR Bard Inc. in 1992 as a Corporate Vice President of Human Resources. In November 1995, Mr. Ring was given additional responsibility for Interventional Cardiology and Electrophysiology. In January 1997, he also resumed additional responsibility for the Cardiac Assist and Cardiopulmonary divisions and in April 1997 was promoted to Group President at Coronary Vascular Products. Prior to this, Mr. Ring was employed at Abbott Laboratories for nearly 10 years, last as the Director of Personnel for the Hospital Products Division. During 1990, he was General Manager at Abbott in the Australian, New Zealand and Indonesian operations. From 1987 to 1989, he was a Director of Personnel for Pacific, Asia, Africa, and Europe. In 1984 to 1986, Mr. Ring served as Director of Personnel for Latin America and South East Asia. Mr. Ring was an Assistant Personnel Manager for the Pharmaceutical Division at Abbott, when he joined in 1983. He was employed at The General Motors Corporation, which he joined after graduation. He serves as the Chairman of the Board at Health Care Institute of New Jersey. He is a Member of the Advisory Board of Ferrer Freeman & Company, LLC. Mr. Ring has  been a Director of Quest Diagnostics Inc. since December 2011. He served as Director of CIT Group Inc. at CIT Holdings, LLC since January 18, 2005 until May 12, 2009. column3: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer,
column10: Mr. Warren E. Buffett serves as the Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President of Berkshire Hathaway Company. Mr. Buffett has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. since 1970. He is the controlling person of Hathaway Inc. He serves as a Member of the Board of Managers at Burlington Northern Santa Fe, LLC. Mr. Buffett served as the Chief Executive Officer and Interim Chairman of Salomon Inc. from August 18, 1991 to June 3, 1992 ... and Director since 1987, and Chief Executive Officer and Interim Chairman of Salomon Brothers Inc. from August 18, 1991 to May 27, 1992. He served as an Investment Salesman from Buffett-Falk & Co., Omaha from 1951 to 1954. Mr. Buffett served as a Securities Analyst at Graham-Newman Corp., New York (Investment Company) from 1954 to 1956. He served as a General Partner at Buffett Partnership, Ltd. and predecessor limited partnerships (private investment partnership) from 1956 to 1969. Mr. Buffett serves as the Chairman of Borsheim Jewelry Company, Inc. He has been a Director of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. since 1965. He has been a Director of The Lubrizol Corporation since September 16, 2011; and MidAmerican Energy Holdings Company since March 2000, H. J. Heinz Company, a Trustee of Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and Trustee of Grinnell College. Mr. Buffett serves as also a Life Trustee of The Urban Institute. He served as a Lead Director of The Washington Post Company until May 12, 2011 and its Director from May 11, 1974 to January 3, 1986 again from May 1996 to May 12, 2011. Mr. Buffett served as a Director of The Coca-Cola Company from 1989 to April 2006 and The Gillette Company. He is Member of The American Academy of Arts and Sciences. Mr. Buffett B. S. in Economics, Columbia University in 1951, B.S. University of Nebraska in 1950, studied Wharton School of Finance at University of Pennsylvania from 1947 to 1949, and graduated from Woodrow Wilson High School, Washington, D.C., in 1947. and Director since 1987, and Chief Executive Officer and Interim Chairman of Salomon Brothers Inc. from August 18, 1991 to May 27, 1992. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Hubert Joly has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Best Buy Co., Inc. since September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide and Chief Executive Officer of Carlson Hotels Worldwide for RADLAX Gateway Hotel, LLC. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of CW Government Travel, Inc. since 2008. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide Inc. from March 1, 2008 to ... September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Companies Inc., and Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group from March 1, 2008 to August 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of P. Lawson Travel since July 2004. He founded Carlson Companies (formerly, Gold Bond Stamp Company) in 1938. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit B.V from July 2004 to April 2008. He was a consultant and then a partner of McKinsey & Company from 1982 to 1996. As a partner, he was specialized in the high-tech sector. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President of Monitoring of US Assets of Vivendi Universal from August 2002 to June 30, 2004. He served as the Deputy Chief Financial Officer of Vivendi Universal (alternate name Vivendi) since April 2003. Mr. Joly served as a Member of the Executive Team of Vivendi Universal. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President and Group Chief Information Officer of Vivendi Universal from November 2001 to November 2002. From December 2000 to October 2001, Mr. Joly was responsible for the integration of Vivendi Universal's North American activities. From July 1999 to June 2001, Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer of Havas Interactive, (known today as Vivendi Universal Games), Vivendi Universal's interactive entertainment and educational software publishing division. Mr. Joly worked in the technology sector from 1996 to 1999 as Vice President of Electronic Data Systems (EDS) Europe and president of EDS France. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of EDS France. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada from 2004 to 2008. He spent 12 years at McKinsey & Company Inc. Mr. Joly has global responsibility for CWT business around the world. He has vast experience and expertise in hospitality and customer service. Mr. Joly served as the Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group from April 2011 to September 13, 2012. He served as the Chairman of the Board of North America of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada since January 2009 until August 17, 2012. He served as Vice Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group since 2008 until April 2011. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corp. since June 30, 2009. He has been a Director of Best Buy Co. Inc. since September 2012. He serves on the Boards of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, the Minnesota Business Partnership, World Travel and Tourism Council and the American Chamber of Commerce in France. He serves as a member of the supervisory board of the Aspen Institute France. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corporation since June 30, 2009. He served as a Director of The Rezidor Hotel Group from 2008 to September 13, 2012 and Carlson Hotels Worldwide, Inc. since March 2008. He served as a Director of Carlson Companies Inc. of Park Inn Houston North Hotel & Conference Center since March 1, 2008. Mr. Joly was honored as one of the 25 Most Influential Executives of the Business Travel Industry in 2006 by Business Travel News magazine. He was also elected a Global Leader for Tomorrow by the World Economic Forum Davos, from 1997 to 1999, and chosen as a young executive of the year by L'Expansion magazine in 1996 and IT CEO of the Year in France in 1998. He recently became a member of the U.S. Department of Commerce Travel and Tourism Advisory Board. He also is a member of the executive committee of the World Travel and Tourism Council, serves on the board of trustees of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, and is a member of the executive committee of the Minnesota Business Partnership. He was honored as one of the 25 Most Influential Executives of the Business Travel Industry (2006) by Business Travel News magazine. He is a graduate of •À__cole des Hautes •À__tudes Commerciales de Paris (HEC Paris) and of the Institut d'Etudes Politiques de Paris. September 2012. column3: Chief Executive Officer and Director,
column10: Dr. George A. Scangos, Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer at Biogen Idec Inc., since June 2010. Dr. Scangos served as President and Chief Executive Officer at Exelixis Inc., a holding company of X-ceptor Therapeutics, Inc. from October 1996 to July 2010. He served as the President of Biotechnology of Bayer Corporation from September 1993 to October 1996 and was responsible for 1,100 employees in research and development, business development, process development, ... manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. He spent 10 years at Bayer Corporation. He joined Bayer in 1987 as a staff scientist. At Bayer, he served in several positions, including Senior Vice President of Research and Development for Bayer's pharmaceutical division and then President of Bayer Biotechnology. He has nearly 25 years of experience in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries. Dr. Scangos served as the Chairman of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since December 31, 2005. He serves as the Vice Chairman of California Healthcare Institute (CHI). He has been a Director of Exelixis, Inc. since October 1996. He serves as a Director at BayBio. He has been a Director of Biogen Idec Inc. since June 2010. He has been an Independent Director of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since October 2003. He serves as a Director of The Global Alliance for TB Drug Development. He served as a Director of Symphony Evolution, Inc. Dr. Scangos served as a Non Executive Director of Entelos, Inc. since September 1997. Dr. Scangos served as a Director of Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from June 2000 to March 2005. He serves as an Adjunct Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University. He previously was a Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University for six years. He serves as a Director of Foundation Sante. He serves on the Board of Visitors at the University of California, San Francisco School of Pharmacy, the Board of Overseers at the University of California, Davis Medical School. He was a Jane Coffin Childs Postdoctoral Fellow in the laboratory of Frank Ruddle at Yale University. Dr. Scangos holds a B.A. in Biology from Cornell University and a Ph.D. in Microbiology from the University of Massachusetts. manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. column10: Mr. Laurence Douglas Fink, also known as Larry, serves as an Executive Officer at PNC Financial Services Group Inc. Mr. Fink serves as Chief Executive Officer of BlackRock Institutional Management Corporation and Blackrock Advisors Holdings, Inc. Mr. Fink has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of BlackRock Inc. since 1998. Mr. Fink serves as the Chief Executive at Private National Mortgage Acceptance Company LLC. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive ... Officer of BlackRock Advisors Inc. Mr. Fink served as the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of Balckrock Advisors, LLC. He founded BlackRock in 1988. He served as Managing Director and Co-Head of the Taxable Fixed Income Division at The First Boston Corporation, where he joined in 1976. Mr. Fink started the financial futures and options department and headed the mortgage and real estate products group. Mr. Fink was instrumental in the creation and evolution of the mortgage-backed security market in the United States. He served as the Chief Executive Officer at BlackRock International Limited. Mr. Fink served as a Member of the Executive Board at NYSE Euronext, Inc. (AKA NYSE Euronext Holdings, LLC). He serves as the Chairman of Nomura BlackRock Asset Management Co., Ltd. He serves as Co-Chairman of Kenneth G. Langone Medical Center. He served as the Chairman of Anthracite Capital Inc. until September 2005. Mr. Fink served as Vice-Chairman of New York University and serves as its Trustee. Mr. Fink serves as a Director of BlackRock Advisors Inc., The Partnership for New York City, Inc. and Financial Services Roundtable, BlackRock International, Ltd., and DSP BlackRock Investment Managers Ltd. He serves as a Director of Blackrock Advisors Holdings, Inc. He has been a Director of BlackRock Inc. since 1998. He serves as a Trustee of Museum of Modern Art, The. He served as a Director of BlackRock International Limited and of Anthracite Capital Inc. from November 1997 to September 2005. He served as a Trustee of The Boys' Club of New York. Mr. Fink served as a Director of VIMRx Pharmaceuticals Inc., New York Stock Exchange, Inc., and Innovir Laboratories Inc. since December 1996. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President, Director and Member of Finance Committee,
column5: University of Pennsylvania - The Wharton School
column10: Mr. William C. Cobb, Bill serves as the Chief Executive Officer and President of H&R Block Bank. Mr. Cobb has been the Chief Executive Officer and the President of H&R Block Inc. since May 16, 2011. He served as the President of eBay Marketplaces of North America at eBay Inc. since December 2006. He served as the President of the flagship U.S. Marketplaces division. He served as President of eBay North America of eBay Inc. from December 2004 to December 2006 and as also ... served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. He served as Senior Vice President of eBay International, a subsidiary of eBay Inc. from September 2002 to December 2004 and also served as its General Manager since September 2002 and Senior Vice President of Global Marketing, where he was responsible for strategic planning, development, and operations for its businesses and investments around the world. He joined eBay in November 2000 and served there until 2008. Prior to eBay, Mr. Cobb served at PepsiCo. as Vice President of New Business and was responsible for new products, joint ventures and acquisitions for the soft drink division. He served various marketing and executive positions at Pepsico/Tricon for thirteen years. He served a number of key positions at Frito Lay and Pepsi-Cola divisions. From February 2000 to June 2000, he served as General Manager of Consumer Sales of Netpliance, Inc. He served as Senior Vice President of International Marketing of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. (now YUM! Brands, Inc.), from July 1997 to February 2000. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer of Pizza Hut, Inc., a division of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. from August 1995 to July 1997. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for Tricon Restaurants International, a PepsiCo spin-off, where he Vice President for Colas of Pepsi-Cola Co., a division of PepsiCo., Inc. from May 1994 to August 1995. He served as an International Chief Marketing Officer of Tricon. Mr. Cobb served as Vice President of Pepsi Brands. He has been a Director at H&R Block, Inc. since August 2010. He serves as a Director of the non-profit Bay Harbor Foundation. He serves on the Advisory Board of the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. He served as a Director of Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC from September 2008 to June 23, 2011; Pacific Sunwear of California Inc. from August 2008 to June 1, 2011 and Orbitz Worldwide Inc. from July 2008 to March 25, 2011. He served as a Member of the Board of Industry Leaders of Consumer Electronics Association. His accomplishments include the launch of All Sport Body Quencher, Aquafina Water, and the Pepsi/Starbucks Coffee partnership for ready-to-drink coffee products. Mr. Cobb holds a Bachelors of Science in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and a Masters of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. He served as Senior Vice President of eBay International, a subsidiary of eBay Inc. from September 2002 to December 2004 and also served as its General Manager since September 2002 and Senior Vice President of Global Marketing, where he was responsible for strategic planning, development, and operations for its businesses and investments around the world. column3: Executive Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of Special Programs Committee and Member of Stock Plan Committee,
column10: Mr. W. James McNerney, also known as Jim, Jr. has been the Chief Executive Officer and Executive Chairman at The Boeing Company at Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. since July 1, 2005. Mr. McNerney served as President at The Boeing Company. Before taking the helm at Boeing on July 1, 2005, he served as the Chief Executive Officer of 3M Company from January 1, 2001 to June 2005, and served as its Chairman from 2001 to June 2005. He served as the Chief Executive Officer ... and Chairman of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. He joined 3M in 2000 after 19 years at the General Electric Company. He joined General Electric in 1982. He served in management positions at General Electric Company, including the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Aircraft Engines from 1997 to 2000. At General Electric, he served as the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Lighting, Cleveland, OH from 1995 to 1997; President of GE Asia-Pacific, Hong Kong from 1993 to 1995, the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Electrical Distribution & Control, Plainville, CT from 1991 to 1992, Executive Vice President of GE Financial Services and GE Capital, Stamford, CT from 1989 to 1991, the President of GE Information Services of Rockville, Managing Director from 1988 to 1989 and as General Manager of GE Mobile Communications from 1982 to 1988. He first worked at Procter & Gamble in brand management and as a Senior Manager of McKinsey & Co., Inc. He serves as Chairman of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. He served as the Chairman of The Business Roundtable since September 1, 2011. He served as the Chairman of US-China Business Council, Inc. and The Business Council. He serves as a Director of The Business Roundtable. He has been an Executive Director of Boeing Co. since 2001. He has been a Presiding Director of Procter & Gamble Co. since August 14, 2007 and has been its Director since May 1, 2003. He serves as a Director of Northwestern Memorial Healthcare, and the Greater Twin Cities United Way. He serves as a Trustee of Center for Strategic and International Studies, Inc. He serves as Trustee of Field Museum Of Natural History and Northwestern University. He serves as a Director of US-China Business Council, Inc. He has been a Director of International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) since 2009. He serves as a Member of the Advisory Board of Kellogg Graduate School of Management and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development. column10: Mr. Michael F. Mahoney, also known as Mike has been the Chief Executive Officer of Boston Scientific Corporation since November 1, 2012 and as its President since October 17, 2011. At Boston Scientific Corporation, Mr. Mahoney is responsible for Boston Scientific's Cardiac Rhythm Management (CRM) and Endoscopy (GI and Pulmonary) businesses, as well as certain corporate functions. He joined Boston Scientific in October 2011, having established a track record of more than ... 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. Prior to joining Boston Scientific, he served as Worldwide Chairman of Medical Device and Diagnostics Group (MD&D) at Johnson & Johnson since January 3, 2011. He served as a Group Chairman, DePuy Franchise of Johnson & Johnson until January 3, 2011. In this role, he successfully drove a growth strategy via product innovation, multiple acquisitions, and International expansion, particularly in China and India. Prior to joining Johnson & Johnson, Mr. Mahoney served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX). He built Global Healthcare Exchange through organic development and strategic acquisitions, successfully integrating seven acquisitions and expanding the business into Europe and Canada. He built his early career at General Electric Medical Systems, where he spent 12 years, in a variety of advancing leadership roles for domestic and global businesses in CT, MRI, X-ray, Healthcare IT, and Nuclear Medicine, culminating in the role of General Manager of the Healthcare Information Technology business. He serves as a Director of Boston Scientific Corporation. Mr. Mahoney earned a B.B.A. in Finance from the University of Iowa and a M.B.A. from Wake Forest University. 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. He serves as a Director of Madison Square Garden of Cablevision Systems Corp. He serves as a Director of the Lustgarten Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research, an organization he helped found in 1998. Mr. Dolan created and managed WKNR-AM, leveland's first all-sports talk radio station. He served as a Member of the board of Live Nation Entertainment, Inc. since June 30, 2011 until February 22, 2013. He is a member of television station WNET's board of trustees and sits on the board and executive committee of the National Cable Television Association (NCTA). An ardent fan of the three MSG teams, he is a frequent presence at their home games. Among his most significant accomplishments, he spearheaded a multi-million dollar effort to restore Radio City Music Hall to its original splendor for the enjoyment of all New Yorkers. Mr. Dolan is honorary chair of Cable Positive's board of directors and serves as chairman of the Capital Campaign Committee at Friends Academy.

He has industry expertise in the agriculture, ... biochemical, chemicals, and service sectors for over 30 years. column3: Chief Executive Officer and Director,
column10: Mr. Satya Nadella has been the Chief Executive Officer of Microsoft Corporation since February 4, 2014. Mr. Nadella joined Microsoft in 1992 and held leadership roles in both enterprise and consumer businesses across Microsoft for over 22 years. He served as Executive Vice President of Cloud & Enterprise Group and President of Server & Tools at Microsoft Corporation until February 04, 2014. He led the transformation to the cloud infrastructure and services business, ... which outperformed the market and took share from competition. Mr. Nadella and his team delivered the ¥Ë_¥Ë_¥Ë_Cloud OS¥Ë_¥Ë_¥Ë_, Microsoft¥Ë_¥Ë_¥Ë_s next generation backend platform. Previously, he served as President of Microsoft¥Ë_¥Ë_¥Ë_s $19 billion Server and Tools Business since February 9, 2011 and led the transformation of the business and technology from client-server software to cloud infrastructure and services. He served as Senior Vice President of Research and Development for the Online Services Division at Microsoft Corporation until February 9, 2011 and also served as Vice President of Microsoft Business Division. Mr. Nadella led Microsoft's engineering efforts in the Online Services Division, which includes the Search (Live Search), Portal (MSN) and Advertising platforms. He served as the Head of Dynamics Business Software Development of Microsoft Corporation and also served as its Corporate Vice President of Microsoft Business Solutions (MBS) and Search & Advertising Platform Group. Mr. Nadella became part of Business Solutions when the division was formed by combining the bCentral, Great Plains and Navision a/s groups. During his six years in MBS, he was responsible for Microsoft Dynamics ERP and the creation of Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Microsoft Office Small Business product lines. Before that, he served as General Manager for the Commerce Platforms Group and led the development efforts for Microsoft Commerce Server and Microsoft BizTalk Server. He served as Executive Vice President at Newmont and Newmont Mining Corporation of Canada Limited from December 2011 to July 2012. Prior to joining Newmont, Mr. Goldberg served as President and Chief Executive Officer at Rio Tinto Minerals. He served in leadership roles in Rio Tinto¥Ë_¥Ë_¥Ë_s coal, gold, copper and industrial minerals businesses. Mr. Goldberg served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of U.S. Borax, Inc. since February 2004. He began his career with Rio Tinto, Borax's parent company in 1981. He served as Managing Director of Coal & Allied Industries Limited in New South Wales, Australia. He served in leadership roles in Rio Tinto's coal, gold, copper, and industrial minerals businesses. He also served at the Australian Government's Business Roundtable on Sustainable Development. He has been a Director at Newmont Mining Corp. since March 1, 2013. Mr. Goldberg serves as a Director for Australian Coal Research Limited, Warkworth Mining Limited Group, Australian Coal Association Sustainable Development Program Limited and Port Waratah Coal Services Limited. He served as an Executive Director of Coal & Allied Industries Limited since July 2001 until February 1, 2004. He was Chairman of the National Mining Association in the United States from 2008 to 2010. He is a Board Member of NSW Minerals Council. Mr. Goldberg has a BS in Mining Engineering from the University of Wisconsin-Platteville and an MBA from the University of Utah.

column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President, Chairman of Executive Committee, Chairman of PSEG Power LLC, Chairman of Public Service Electric & Gas Company, Chief Executive Officer of PSEG Power LLC and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Electric & Gas Company,
column10: Dr. Ralph Izzo, Ph.D., has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since April 1, 2007 and has been its President since October 1, 2007. Dr. Izzo has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Electric and Gas Company (PSE&G) and PSEG Power LLC since April 1, 2007. He has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC since July 2008. Dr. Izzo has been an Executive Vice President ... of Exelon Electric & Gas and President of Exelon Energy Delivery at Exelon Corp. since July 2005. He served as Chief Operating Officer of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since October 1, 2007. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Public Service Electric and Gas Company (PSE&G) a subsidiary of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. from October 18, 2003 to October 1, 2006. Dr. Izzo served as Vice President, OFlynnto Utility Operations of PSE&G from June 2002 to October 2003. He served as Vice President, Special Projects of PSEG Services Corporation (Services) from September 2001 to June 2002. He served as the President of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC from July 2008 to June 2009. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC since October 1, 2006. He served as Vice President, Appliance Service of PSE&G from April 2000 to September 2001 and also served as Vice President, Corporate Planning of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. (PSEG) from March 1998 to April 2000. He joined PSE&G in 1992 and was elected to several executive positions within PSEG's family of companies, including PSE&G senior vice president of utility operations. Dr. Izzo serves as the Chairman at New Jersey After 3 Inc. He serves as the Chairman of the Board of Governors and a Member of Board of Trustees at Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. He has more than 20 years experience as a senior executive in the energy industry. He has been a Director of Public Service Electric & Gas Co (PSE&G) since October 1, 2006 , PSEG Power LLC since October 2006, Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since October 1, 2006, PSEG Energy Holdings since October 1, 2006, Williams Companies, Inc. since March 14, 2013 and The National Center on Addiction and Substance Abuse at Columbia University since November 16, 2011. He serves on the board of directors at the Electric Power Research Institute, the New Jersey Chamber of Commerce, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center and the New Jersey Utilities Association. He serves on the board of trustees for the Partnership for a Drug-Free New Jersey, Independent College Fund of New Jersey, the Industrial Advisory Group, The College of New Jersey and New Jersey Network. He serves as a director of Edison Electric Institute (EEI), the Nuclear Energy Institute (NEI), the Institute for Nuclear Power Operations (INPO), and The Center for Energy Workforce Development. He is also a member of the Columbia University Engineering Board of Visitors. He served as a Director of American Gas Association. He also serves as Co-chair of the Drumthwacket Foundation, a Member of the Rutgers Business School Board of Trustees, and electric utility Sector Chairman of the Infrastructure Advisory Committee in the Attorney General's Office of Counter-Terrorism. Dr. Izzo is a well-known leader within the utility industry - as well as the public policy arena. His public policy experience includes service as an American Physical Society Congressional Science Fellow, in the office of U.S. Senator Bill Bradley. He also served four years as a senior policy advisor in the Office of New Jersey Governor Thomas H. Kean, specializing in energy, science and technology. Dr. Izzo's career began as a research scientist at the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory, performing numerical simulations of fusion energy experiments. He has published or presented over 35 papers on magneto hydrodynamic modeling. He is listed in numerous editions of Who's Who and has been the recipient of national fellowships and awards. In addition, he has completed a nuclear reactor technology course for utility executives at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He received Honorary Degrees from the New Jersey Institute of Technology (Doctor of Science), Thomas A. Edison State College (Doctor of Humane Letters),and Bloomfield College (Doctor of Humane Letters). In August 2002, he completed the requirements for a Master of Business Administration degree, with a concentration in finance from the Rutgers Graduate School of Management. He received his Bachelor of Science and Master of Science Degrees in mechanical engineering, and his Doctor of Philosophy degree in applied physics from Columbia University. He Completed nuclear reactor technology course from Massachusetts Institute of Technology. of Exelon Electric & Gas and President of Exelon Energy Delivery at Exelon Corp. since July 2005. column10: Mr. Howard D. Schultz serves as Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President of Starbucks Coffee Singapore Pte. Ltd. Mr. Schultz has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Starbucks Corporation since January 2008. He founded Starbucks Corporation in 1985 and has been its Chairman since 1985. He is a Co-Founder and Partner of Maveron LLC and serves as its Member of Management Board. He is a Co-Founder and Partner of Maveron Equity Partners IV, L.P. He co-founded ... Maveron LLC in 1998. Mr. Schultz served as the Chief Global Strategist at Starbucks Corporation from June 2000 to February 2005 and its Chief Executive Officer from 1985 to June 2000. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of Executive Committee and Member of Operating Committee,
column10: Mr. Jay S. Fishman has been Chief Executive Officer of The Travelers Companies, Inc. since  since October 2001. Mr. Fishman served as the President of The Travelers Companies, Inc., from October 2001 to June 2008. Mr. Fishman has served as the Chief Executive Officer of Travelers since the April 2004 merger of The St. Paul Companies, Inc. with Travelers Property Casualty Corp. that formed Travelers. He served as the President, Chairman, and Chief Administrative officer ... of Travelers Property Casualty Corp. Mr. Fishman served as the Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Operating Officer, Commercial Lines of Travelers Insurance Group Holdings Inc. from 1996 to 1998. He served as the Chief Administrative Officer at Travelers Insurance Group Inc. (TIGI) since 1996. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Travelers Insurance Group Holdings Inc. since 1998. He first became associated with Travelers when he was named the insurer's Chief Financial Officer in 1993, upon its acquisition by Primerica Corp., where he served as an Executive. He served as the Treasurer of Travelers Group from 1991 to 1993, Chief Financial Officer of Travelers Group's Consumer and Financial Services Group from 1989 to 1991. He joined Travelers Group in 1989. He led The St. Paul Companies Inc. as the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer since October 2001 until April 2004. In April 2004, St. Paul Companies merged with Travelers Property Casualty Corp., which had since been divested by Citigroup. Prior to joining The St. Paul Companies, Mr. Fishman held several executiv eposts at Citigroup Inc. from 1998 to 2001. He served as the Chief Executive Officer, President and Chief Operating Officer of Finance & Risk at Citigroup Inc. since April 1989 and also served as its President and Chief Executive Officer. He served as the Head of Citigroup's global insurance businesses and the consumer business in Japan and Western Europe. Mr. Fishman held several key executive posts at Primerica, Travelers and Citigroup from 1989 to October 2001. Prior to 1989, he served at Shearson Lehman Brothers, where he served as a Senior Vice President of Merchant Banking. Previously, he served as a Principal in a private investment and leveraged buyout firm, and a Director for Mergers and Acquisitions of American Can Company. He has been the Chairman of  The Travelers Companies, Inc. since September 12, 2005.He has been the Chairman of New York City Ballet, Inc., since June 19, 2012 and also serves as its Director. He has been a Director of Carlyle Group Management LLC, a General Partner of The Carlyle Group LP since May 2, 2012. He has been an Executive Director of The Travelers Companies, Inc., since October 2001. He has been a Director at Exxon Mobil Corp., since May 26, 2010 and has been Presiding Director since 2013. He serves as a Director of Committee Encouraging Corporate Philanthropy and The Carlyle Group LP. He serves on the Board of Directors of the National Academy Foundation and is an active member of The Business Council. He serves as a Director of the New York Philharmonic; Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, Inc. and Trustee of New York-Presbyterian Hospital. He serves as a Director of The Partnership for New York City, Inc. and New York City Ballet, Inc. At the University of Pennsylvania, he is a Member of the Board of Trustees and the Industry Advisory Board of the Financial Institutions Center for The Wharton School. He is also a Member of the Board of Overseers of the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine. Mr. Fishman served as the Chairman of Travelers Insurance Group Holdings Inc. from March 2000 to January 2001 and Vice Chairman from 1996 to 1998. He served as a Vice Chairman of TIGI since 1995. He serves as a Vice Chairman of the Kennedy Center Corporate Fund Board. Mr. Fishman served as a Director of Englewood Hospital & Medical Center, Board Member of Connecticut Public Broadcasting, Inc.; Platinum Underwriters Holdings Ltd. from June 2002 to April 29, 2005; and Nuveen Investments Inc. from October 2001 to August 4, 2005. He served as a Director of The St. Paul Companies, Inc. since October 10, 2011 and Travelers Insurance Group Holdings, Inc. since 1998. column10: Mr. John J. Koraleski, also known as Jack, serves as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Union Pacific Railroad Company. He served as an Executive Vice President of Marketing and Sales of Union Pacific Railroad, a subsidiary of Union Pacific ... Corp. from March 1999 to March 15, 2012. He was responsible for Union Pacific's six major business units, agriculture, automotive, chemicals, energy, industrial products and intermodal. He served as an Executive Vice President of Marketing & Sales of Union Pacific Corp., and also served as its Controller from August 1998 to March 1999. Prior to that, as Executive Vice President of Finance of the Railroad. He served more than 30 years with the railroad, where he served a number of executive positions. column10: Ms. Debra A. Cafaro, J.D., serves as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at Ventas Inc. since January 28, 2003 and March 5, 1999 respectively. Previously, she served as the President at the firm since March 5, 1999. Ms. Cafaro is the Chief Executive Officer and President at Ventas Capital. She was the President from April 1997 to May 1998 and Director since April 1997 at Ambassador Apartments Inc. Ms. Cafaro was a Founding Member at Barack Ferrazzano in Chicago, ... where she practiced real estate, corporate, and finance law for 13 years. She became a Partner in 1987 at the firm, where her areas of concentration were finance (including tax-exempt debt) and real estate. She has been a Director at Weyerhaeuser Co. since February 15, 2007. Ms. Cafaro serves as a Director of World Business Chicago and Real Estate Roundtable. She is the Chairman for 2009-2010 and a Member of the Board of Governors of the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts and will be focused on articulating the value proposition of real estate investment trusts and working with policymakers on initiatives to increase debt and equity capital flows to REITs. She was the First Vice Chair of NAREIT for 2008-2009. She is admitted to the Bar in Illinois and Pennsylvania. Ms. Cafaro is a Member of the Visiting Committee of the University of Chicago Law School and a Chapter Director of the National Association of Corporate Directors. Ms. Cafaro has been named an Outstanding Woman by National Real Estate Investor Magazine (2008); a Woman of Influence by Real Estate Forum (2008); Female Leader of the Year by Commercial Property News (2007); one of "50 Women to Watch" by the Wall Street Journal (2004); and one of the "Best of the Best" REIT CEOs (2003). She received her J.D. cum laude from the University of Chicago Law School in 1982 and B.A. magna cum laude from the University of Notre Dame in 1979."

column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of The Verizon Wireless,
column10: Mr. Lowell C. McAdam has been Chairman of Verizon Communications Inc., since January 1, 2012 and its Chief Executive Officer since August 1, 2011. Mr. McAdam served as President of Verizon Communications Inc. since October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Operating Officer at Verizon Communications Inc. since October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Verizon Wireless, a Joint Venture of Verizon Communications Inc. from January 1, 2007 ... to October 1, 2010. He served as an Executive Vice President of Verizon Communications Inc. until October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Cellco Partnership until October 01, 2010. He served as an Executive Vice President of Verizon Wireless. Prior to, he served as an Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for Verizon Wireless. He served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of PrimeCo Personal Communications, a joint venture owned by Bell Atlantic and Vodafone AirTouch from 1997 to 2000. Mr. McAdam served as the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of PrimeCo from 1994 to 1997, where he was responsible for overseeing the build, deployment and successful launch of its customer service operations and all-digital network. He served as the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of Cellco Partnership since April 2000. Mr. McAdam served as a Vice President of International Operations at AirTouch Communications and was lead technical partner for cellular ventures in Spain, Portugal, Sweden, Italy, Korea and Japan. He joined AirTouch as Executive Director of international applications and operations in 1993. From 1983 to 1993, he held various executive positions with Pacific Bell, including Area Vice President of Bay Area Marketing and General Manager of South Bay customer services. He worked for six years in the U.S. Navy's Engineer Corps. He has been the Chairman of the Board at Cellco Partnership, Inc. since October 01,2010. He has been Chairman of the Verizon Wireless since September 2010 and it Director since 2003. He has been a Director of Verizon Communications Inc. since Marc 4, 2011. He serves as a Director of Cellular Telecommunications & Internet Association. He served as a Director of the CTIA. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President,
column10: Dr. Jeffrey M. Leiden, M.D., Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. since February 1, 2012. Dr. Leiden has been Managing Director of Clarus Ventures since 2007. Dr. Leiden joined Clarus Ventures in November 1, 2006 as a Partner. Dr. Leiden has more than 20 years of experience in the biomedical and pharmaceutical sectors. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer at Abbott Laboratories Pharmaceutical Products Group ... in 2001. Dr. Leiden served as an Executive Vice President, Pharmaceuticals and Chief Scientific Officer from 2000 to 2001 at Abbott Laboratories. During his academic career, he was involved in starting several biotechnology companies including Vical and Cardiogene Therapeutics Inc. From 1987 to 2000, Dr. Leiden served several academic appointments including the Chief of Cardiology and Director of the Cardiovascular Research Institute at the University of Chicago at University of Chicago School of Medicine. From July 1999 to July 2000, he served as an Elkan R. Blout Professor of Biological Sciences, Harvard School of Public Health and Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School. From 1992 to July 1999, Dr. Leiden was the Frederick H. Rawson Professor of Medicine and Pathology. He has been Chairman of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. since May 2012.  Dr. Leiden has been Chairman of the Board of Directors of VBI Vaccines. Dr. Leiden served as Chairman of the Board of Directors of Lycera Corp. Dr. Leiden served as Chairman of the Board of Directors of TYRX, Inc. (formerly TyRx Pharma, Inc.) since February 28, 2008. He served as Vice Chairman of Shire plc from April 2009 to January 31, 2012. Dr. Leiden has been a Director of Biolex Therapeutics, Inc. since October 2008. He serves as Director of Catabasis Pharmaceuticals. He has been a Director of Abbott Laboratories since 1999. Dr. Leiden has been a Director of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated, since July 7, 2009. He served as a Non-Executive Director of the Board of Shire plc from January 1, 2007 to January 31, 2012. He served as a Director of TYRX, Inc. since February 2008. He served as Member of the Scientific Advisory Board at Massachusetts Life Sciences Center until September 30, 2011. He served as an Independent Director of Millennium Pharmaceuticals Inc. since October 4, 2007. He served as Director of TAP Pharmaceutical Products Inc. Dr. Leiden serves as a Member of the Board of Trustees of the Ravinia Festival, the Museum of Science and Industry, the Keystone Symposia, and the Penn Medicine Board of the University of Pennsylvania. He also serves as the Chairman at the University of Pennsylvania, School of Medicine. Dr. Leiden serves as a Member of the American Society of Clinical Investigation and the American Association of Physicians. In 2001, he was elected a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and Member of the Institute of Medicine of the National Academy of Sciences. During his 14 year career in academia, Dr. Leiden published more than 130 peer reviewed papers. Dr. Leiden earned both, an M.D. and a Ph.D. from the University of Chicago. He has also received an honorary M.A. from Harvard University. Dr. Leiden earned a bachelor's degree in biological sciences from the University of Chicago. in 2001. Mr. McMillon served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Wal-Mart International Operations at Wal-Mart Stores from February 1, 2009 to February 1, 2014. He served as an Executive Vice President of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. since August 4, 2005. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of SAM'S West, Inc., ... (alternate name Sam's Club) from August 4, 2005 to April 3, 2009. He was responsible for the overall corporate strategy and direction of Sam's Club. Mr. McMillon served as an Executive Vice President of Merchandising and Replenishment of Sam's Club of Wal Mart Stores Inc. until August 2005. He worked two consecutive summers as an Associate at the Wal-Mart Distribution Centers in Northwest Arkansas. He served as a Buyer Trainee for Wal-Mart working in Store #894 in Tulsa, OK. He has been a Director of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. since November 2013 and Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB De CV since 2009. He serves as Director of US-China Business Council, Inc. column10: Mr. Gregory D. Wasson, also known as Greg, has been Chief Executive Officer and President of Walgreen Co. since February 1, 2009 and May 1, 2007 respectively. Mr. Wasson served as Treasurer of National Association of Chain Drug Stores, Inc. since April 2010. He served as the President of Catalyst Rx Health Initiatives, Inc since March 2002. He joined Walgreens as a pharmacy intern in 1980 and managed several Houston Walgreens drugstores and served as its District Manager ... in 1986. He served as a Regional Vice President of Store Operations of Walgreen Co. in 1999. He served as an Executive Vice President of Walgreens Health Initiatives since 2001. Mr. Wasson served as the president of Walgreens Health Initiatives in 2002, and Walgreens senior vice president in 2004 and a Walgreens executive vice president in 2005. He served as President of Walgreens Health Services until May 1, 2007. He served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of Walgreen Co at Walgreens Health Services since May 1, 2007. He served as Chairman for the National Association of Chain Drug Stores, Inc. since April 23, 2012 and Vice Chairman since May 2, 2011. He also serves on the boards of the Retail Industry Leaders Association, the Healthcare Leadership Council and the Consumer Goods Forum, among other organizations. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President and Member of Executive Committee,
column10: Mr. Robert A. Iger, also known as Bob, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at The Walt Disney Company since October 2, 2005 and has been its Chairman since March 13, 2012. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of The Walt Disney Company from January 2000 to September 2005 and its President since January 2000. He served as the President of Walt Disney International and Chairman of the ABC Group from February 1999 to January 2000. He held a number of ... increasingly responsible positions at ABC, Inc. and its predecessor Capital Cities/ ABC, Inc., culminating in service as the President and Chief Operating Officer of ABC, Inc. from 1994 to 1999. He officially joined the Disney senior management team in 1996 as Chairman of the Disney-owned ABC Group. He began his career at ABC in 1974 as a Studio Supervisor in New York, then moved to ABC Sports, where he advanced over a 12-year period through a series of increasingly responsible management posts. Mr. Iger has held a series of increasingly responsible senior management positions at ABC, where he guided the complex merger of ABC at The Walt Disney Company. He served as Vice President of Programming and was responsible for all scheduling and program acquisitions at ABC Sports since 1987. He served as the President of ABC Entertainment in Los Angeles. He served as the President of the ABC Television Network Group in New York since 1993. During his years at ABC, he oversaw its broadcast television network and station, cable television, radio and publishing businesses, which includes the market leading brands of ABC, ESPN, Lifetime, A&E and The History Channel. He served as the Chief Executive Officer of MarketWatch, Inc. since 2006. He was employed at ABC Holding Company, Inc. He served as the Chairman of the Disney-owned ABC Group since 1996. Mr. Iger has been a Director of The Walt Disney Co. since 2000. He has been an Independent Director of Apple Inc. since November 2011. He has been a Board Member of the U.S.-China Business Council in June 2011. He is also a Member of the Partnership for a New American Economy, a coalition of mayors and business leaders from across the United States that support comprehensive immigration reform. He serves as a Director of National September 11 Memorial & Museum at the World Trade Center Foundation, Inc., Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts Inc., and New York City Outward Bound. In June 2010, he was appointed as U.S. President's Export Council, which advises the U.S. president on how to promote U.S. exports, jobs and growth. He serves as a Trustee of the Museum of Television and Radio of Ithaca College. Mr. Iger serves as a Trustee of American Film Institute. He serves as a Member of Foundation Committee at The Motion Picture and Television Fund. He serves on the Executive Advisory Board of the Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation. He served as a Director of ABC, Inc. (formerly Capital Cities/ABC Inc.) since 1994 and Infoseek Corp., since November 1998. He was employed at ESPN Holding Company, Inc. He has been named one of Fortune magazine's ï¾Šï¾—ï¾“25 Most Powerful People in Businessï¾Šï¾—ï¾“ (2006, 2007); one of the ï¾Šï¾—ï¾“Top Gun CEOsï¾Šï¾—ï¾“ by Forbes magazine (2009) and one of the ï¾Šï¾—ï¾“Best CEOsï¾Šï¾—ï¾“ by Institutional Investor magazine (2008, 2009, 2010, 2011). He graduated magna cum laude. Mr. Iger holds a BS in Communications from Ithaca College. increasingly responsible positions at ABC, Inc. and its predecessor Capital Cities/ ABC, Inc., culminating in service as the President and Chief Operating Officer of ABC, Inc. from 1994 to 1999. column10: Mr. Joseph R. Swedish, known as Joe, has been the Chief Executive Officer of WellPoint Inc. since March 25, 2013. Mr. Swedish serves as an Advisor of China Health Care Corporation. He served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Trinity Health Corporation since December 2004. He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Centura Health Inc. from January 1999 to January 2005. Since joining Centura Health in 1999, Mr. Swedish has focused his efforts on ... ensuring the financial stability and service excellence of its core operations. From March 1994 to January 1999, he served as President and Chief Executive Officer of the East Florida Division of Columbia and Central Florida Division at HCA Healthcare Corporation (Hospital Corporation of America). Mr. Swedish has been a Director of WellPoint Inc. since March 25, 2013, Trinity Health Corporation since January 2005 and of Cross Country Inc. since October 2001. He served as a Director of Cross Country Healthcare, Inc. from October 2001 to May 10, 2006, Coventry Health Care Inc. from February 25, 2010 to February 12, 2013 and Rehabcare Group Inc., from June 2004 to February 18, 2005. He served as a Director of Centura Health since January 1999. He serves as Chairman of the Public Education and Business Coalition and a board member of the Metro Denver Boy Scouts, the Colorado Forum and Colorado Concern. He serves as Vice Chairman of the Colorado Health and Hospital Association and member of the American Hospital Association Regional Policy Board (Region 8). He serves as a Trustee at Loyola University of Chicago. Mr. Swedish has more than 40 years of diverse executive healthcare leadership experience to WellPoint, including 24 years serving as Chief Executive Officer for major health and hospital systems. Mr. Swedish serves on numerous committees and boards, including the National Quality Forum (NQF) Quality Healthcare Advisory Committee, the National Center of Healthcare Leadership Board, the Health Leadership Council, the Catholic Health Association Board, the Health Sector Advisory Council, the Institute for Diversity in Healthcare Management Board, and the Catholic CEO Healthcare Connection. column3: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer,
column10: Ms. Ursula M. Burns has been Chief Executive Officer of Xerox Corp. since July 2009 and its Chairman since May 20, 2010. Ms. Burns served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Catalyst, Inc. and serves as its Director. She served as the President of Xerox Corp. from April 3, 2007 to July 2009. She served as a Senior Vice President and President of Business Group Operations of Xerox Corp. from December 2002 to April 2007 and its Corporate Senior Vice President ... from April 2000 to April 3, 2007. She joined Xerox in 1980 as a Mechanical Engineering summer intern, where she was responsible for global research, engineering, marketing and manufacturing of Xerox technology and supplies. She served as an Executive Assistant to the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Xerox Corporation from 1991 to 1992 and in various other positions at Xerox Corporation from 1982 to 1991. From 1992 to 2000, Ms. Burns served as the Vice President and General Manager of a series of Xerox Businesses, including the Office Color and Facsimile Business, Office Network Copying Business, Work Group Copier Business and Xerox's Departmental Business Unit. She served in following positions at Xerox, Vice President and General Manager of Departmental Business Unit from 1997 to 1999; Senior Vice President of Worldwide Manufacturing and Supply Chain Services from 1999 to 2000; Senior Vice President of Corporate Strategic Services from 2000 to October 2001; and President of Document Systems and Solutions Group from October 2001 to January 2003. She has been a Director of Xerox Corp. since April 3, 2007; Exxon Mobil Corporation since November 27, 2012; American Express Company since January 26, 2004 and Hunt Corporation since 1999. She serves as a Director at Fuji Xerox Co., Ltd and Kennedy Center Corporate Fund. She also serves on the Boards of Directors of the National Association of Manufacturers and the Rochester Business Alliance. column3: Chief Executive Officer and Director,
column10: Mr. Michael S. McGavick, also known as Mike, has been the Chief Executive Officer of XL Group Plc since May 1, 2008 and served as its President. Mr. McGavick served as President of Safeco Corp. since January 30, 2001 and Chairman January 1, 2003. He served as the Chief Executive Officer of Safeco Corp., from January 30, 2005 to August 31, 2005. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of CNA Agency Market Operations from October 1997 to January 2001, and President ... of CNAï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Commercial Lines group from January 1997 to October 1997, and held a series of executive positions with CNAï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s commercial insurance operations from 1995 to October 1997. Mr. McGavick led the development of its P&C business model: offering auto, homeowners and small-business insurance products over a unified sales-and-service platform through a common network of independent distributors. He served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of CNA Financial Corporation's largest operating unit, responsible for the majority of CNA's commercial insurance business. In addition, he engineered CNA's e-commerce strategy. He served as lead negotiator for the insurance industry with Congress, federal agencies and groups concerned about reform of the nation's Superfund laws. Before that, Mr. McGavick held a series of public affairs positions, including: Partner with The Gallatin Group, a Seattle public affairs firm, from 1991 to 1992; Chief of Staff for U.S. Senator Slade Gorton from 1989 to 1991, and campaign manager for Gorton's successful comeback campaign in 1988; Vice President of the Washington Roundtable, a research group composed of the top executives of Washington state's largest corporations, from 1986 to 1988; and Vice President of The Rockey Company, a Seattle-based public affairs firm. He has been a Director of XL Group plc, since April 2008. He served as a Director of Safeco Corp., since January 30, 2001 and Superfund Improvement Project for the American Insurance Association from 1992 to 1995. Mr. McGavick attended the University of Washington, graduating in 1983 with a degree in Political Science. of CNAï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s Commercial Lines group from January 1997 to October 1997, and held a series of executive positions with CNAï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s commercial insurance operations from 1995 to October 1997. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Ms. Marissa A. Mayer has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Yahoo! Inc at Yahoo! UK Limited since July 17, 2012. Ms. Mayer served as Vice President of Location & Local Services of Google, Inc. from October 12, 2010 to July 16, 2012. She served as Vice President of Search Products & User Experience of Google Inc. She served as Vice President of Google Product Search. She served as Vice President of Local and Maps of Google, where she oversaw product management, ... engineering, design and strategy for its suite of local and geographical products, including Google Maps, Google Earth, Zagat, Street View, and local search, for desktop and mobile. She also curated the Google Doodle program, celebrating special events on Google's homepage around the world. During her 13 Years at Google, she served numerous positions, including engineer, designer, product manager and executive, and launched more than 100 well-known features and products. She played an instrumental role in Google search, leading the product management effort for more than 10 years, a period during which Google Search grew from a few hundred thousand to well over a billion searches per day. She led the development of some of Google's most successful services including image, book and product search, toolbar, and iGoogle, and defined such pivotal products as Google News and Gmail. Ms. Mayer is listed as an inventor on several patents in artificial intelligence and interface design. She joined Google as first female engineer in 1999 and played an important role in developing Google's culture. Her contributions included overseeing the look-and-feel of Google's iconic homepage and founding the Associate Product Manager program, which has hired over 300 of Google's future leaders and is considered the industry's ideal standard in transforming new computer science graduates into executive leaders. Prior to Google, she served at the UBS research lab in Zurich, Switzerland and at SRI International in Menlo Park, California. She has been a Director at Aliph, Inc. since May 1, 2013. She has been a Director at Wal-Mart Stores Inc. since 2012 and Yahoo! Inc. since July 17, 2012. She serves as a Director of San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and the New York City Ballet, Inc. She serves as a Trustee of San Francisco Ballet Association. She has been a Member of Executive Council at TechNet since March 14, 2013. She has been honored with the Matrix Award by the New York Women in Communications, as a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum, and as Woman of the Year" by Glamour magazine. Fortune has named Ms. Mayer one of the 50 Most Powerful Women in Business
